result.execSummary:
The defendant Geoffrey A. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Agent approves, Court has no objection to early release after 6 months.

miscConds.notes: Domestic abuse and DNA surcharges imposed.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages unless authorized by Agent. 
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Marc Simon and/or Linda Deiner without written authorization from Agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geoffrey A. Erickson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Geoffrey A. Erickson in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea. 
Per DA Snider, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders sentence withheld, Probation 1 year. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs, including DOMAB 
- pay supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess/consume alcohol unless authorized by Agent 
- no contact directly/indirectly with Marc Simon and/or Linda Deiner without written authorization from Agent 
- 30 days jail, stayed to be used at Agent's discretion 
- if Agent approves, Court has no objection to early release after 6 months 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
Status conference on April 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
